query: How do extensions of the standard model, such as supersymmetric extensions, build upon our current understanding of CP violation and its role in new physics beyond the electroweak standard model?

citation_function_classification.justification: The query asks how supersymmetric extensions build upon (extend) the existing understanding of CP violation, and why this understanding motivates exploring new physics beyond the electroweak Standard Model.
